SALESFORCE HELP
DOCS
MARKETING CLOUD GROWTH
Track Landing Page Activity with a Consent Banner

To protect the privacy of your landing page visitors, use the default web banner to collect consent for tracking. You can customize the web banner style in Setup, or use the default styles. Then, publish the banner to your Marketing Landing Pages site in Digital Experiences.

REQUIRED EDITIONS AND USER PERMISSIONS
Available in: Salesforce Enterprise and Unlimited Editions with Marketing Cloud Growth Edition


USER PERMISSIONS
NEEDED
To customize the tracking consent banner:	Modify All Data OR Marketing Cloud Admin permission set

To track activity on a landing page that uses a custom domain, add a custom URL for that domain in Setup and define the path as /lp.

From Setup, in the Quick Find box, enter Web Tracking, and then select Web Tracking Setup.
To customize the banner, edit the default text and enter a link to your company privacy policy. Use the style fields to customize the banner’s position, fonts, and colors.
Add the banner integration to your landing pages.
From Setup, in the Quick Find box, enter All Sites, and select All Sites under Digital Experiences.
Next to Marketing Landing Pages, select Builder.
Landing pages in Marketing Cloud Growth use the Digital Experiences Sites framework. This site operates behind the scenes. Don’t add content to it.
Click Settings and select Integrations.
On the Data Cloud integration, click Add to Site, and enable it.
On the Data Cloud Web Tracking Consent Banner integration, click Add to Site, and enable it.
To apply the banner and styles to your landing pages, click Publish.

After publishing, if you change the banner text or style settings, publish the banner again in Digital Experiences. To test the banner on a real page, create and view a landing page in a web browser.

title: Setting Up Landing Page Tracking with Consent
